messages.title: Getting things done for Edinburgh South
Standing up against a hard Brexit
messages.content: I've been fighting tirelessly against a hard Brexit: both in Parliament, when I voted against triggering Article 50, and locally where I campaigned for Remain. We now need to ensure the best possible deal for the UK but can't give Theresa May a blank cheque.

messages.title: Fighting for equality and better public services
messages.content: For too long the constitution has dominated political conversation in Scotland. Our cherished public services have suffer as a result - whether education or the NHS under the SNP, or Tory social security cuts. I'll continue to fight for quality and better public services.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: NO to a second independence referendum
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Nicola Sturgeon and the SNP will use this election, as they have used Brexit, as a way to secure independence. In Edinburgh South, we have a chance to send a clear message: we do not want another referendum. It is not the right path and will only increase division and uncertainty.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In 2015, I defeated the SNP candidate by just 2,637 votes, while the Conservatives trailed by over 10,000. Despite various policies and parties, it's a clear choice between me and the SNP here in Edinburgh South. With a recent poll by Survation giving my team the competitive edge, your vote will really count.

issues.brexitEurope: Standing up against a hard Brexit.
issues.governance: NO to a second independence referendum.
issues.health: Fighting for equality and better public services.
issues.socialWelfare: Fighting for equality and better public services.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have fought tirelessly against a hard Brexit and for quality public services. You are my boss and I will continue to stand up for your interests.

politicalExperience.achievements: Voted against triggering Article 50, campaigned for Remain.

endorsements.endorsement: Robin Harper backs Ian Murray appreciating his sense of responsibility as an MP towards his constituents and Scotland and his commitment to his duties as an MP.

quotes.text: Ian Murray: 'You are my boss. If I am re-elected, I will continue to stand up for your interests'

images.caption: Supporters with Ian Murray campaign materials.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Described as Scotland's hardest working MP as rated by charity MySociety.
